content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]+" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the column name to lower case, then removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`, and finally replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores. The `replace` function uses a regular expression to match one or more spaces or hyphens (`r"[ -]+"`), replacing them with an underscore.
